intro: Cabrera chrysoblepharis, commonly known as the golden-eyed daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that resemble daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
